data.title: Add Command: Copy All - Current panel output (no focus needed)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
As a continuation of the newly added "Copy All" ContextMenu option @isidorn added
it would also be very useful to have a pure keyboard access for this and other output windows.

As far as I can tell from experimentation and looking at all the commands, I cannot seem
to copy terminal output using only the keyboard . if one word is clicked on with the mouse
the Terminal: Copy Selected would apply. There does not seem to be a way to enlarge the selection
with the keyboard.
It would also be helpful with moving output.

A Copy All for any output would be highly useful and much easier for keyboard only users.
I looked at the extension API and I don't think this can be done with an extension , but I may have missed something. It still makes sense to me as a built-in command, .

data.title: Add Command: Focus on panel action bar drop-down

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
All OS'

For keyboard users/disabled using Tab to get to the panel action bar it's a bit of a journey.
While there are several focus or show commands including individual commands for multiple terminals,
Extensions and some other items need to be selected from the drop-down. DirectFocus
would be great and would also make it easier to get to the other action items with arrows

data.title: "write error: Broken pipe" in terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3 (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the terminal, running /bin/bash
2. Paste in the code for the _random_string function, shown below.
3. Run the function. You'll get "write error: Broken pipe"
4. Note that this does not happen in gnome-terminal on the same PC.

```
function _random_string() {
    env LC_CTYPE=C tr -dc -- 'A-Za-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | head -c 12
}
```

Expected output (per gnome-terminal):

```
roger@roger-pc:~ $ function _random_string() { env LC_CTYPE=C tr -dc -- 'A-Za-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | head -c 12; }
roger@roger-pc:~ $ _random_string
Es3YEHmzezgCroger@roger-pc:~ $ 
```

Actual output (in VS code terminal):

```
roger@roger-pc:~ $ function _random_string() { env LC_CTYPE=C tr -dc -- 'A-Za-z0-9' < /dev/urandom | head -c 12; }
roger@roger-pc:~ $ _random_string
92wcrvYW2Cx8tr: write error: Broken pipe
tr: write error
```

data.title: Toggle Extension auto update
data.body:
I think we should add an option to toggle the extension auto-update in this menu - perhaps we considered this and did not do it for some reason?

From my point of view it will help with discovery and it's also good even if we do many auto-update the new default i.e. users will be able to turn off without needing to go int settings editing.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/26262642/55a02602-3c8a-11e7-88f8-bb62dae674be.png)

cc // @egamma

data.title: Pattern match on global search matches line preceding pattern
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (ec76a9fc5146b822cdb14b982ac3e5b470dd646a, 2017-05-19T08:07:58.056Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|swagger-viewer|Arjun|1.4.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.14|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|vscode-whitespacer|deerawan|1.0.0|
|pgsql|doublefint|0.0.7|
|vscode-sql-connect|dvdbrink|0.2.1|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|2.1.4|
|mssql|ms-mssql|1.0.0|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.19|;

Found when trying to replace needless semicolons in JavaScript

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a javascript project or file
2. Global search for ';\n'
3. Set 'Use Regular Expression'
4. Set replacement to '\n'
5. Search
6. Replace All
7. Instead of replacing ';', VS matches and replaces the entire line up to ';'

This works fine on current file search/replace

data.title: Can't find files starting with `./` on MacOS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press `cmd+p`
2. Type `./` and a file name that exists in the root of the project

Result:
No files are found.

Desired result:
The file was found.

This is somewhat relevant as it's quite common to copy the qualified path name from another application, like the terminal for instance, and that file path will contain the `./` bit.

data.title: Reduce search requests to Marketplace backend

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
MP team suggested a couple ideas to reduce the load on their servers. 

1. Increase the threshold we make a request from 300ms to 500ms. 
2. Don't make requests for search queries less than three characters, unless the user hits enter (that covers the "c" case). 

They also suggested making search only happen on enter, but my thought is that's not optimal for users. 

Worth exploring the above options to reduce the load, which will lead to better perf for everyone.

data.title: Navigate through past commit messages, just as search works

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider
- OS Version: any

This is a feature request. 

In the search boxes (both local and multifile) you can use ALT- to navigate through your search history. I suggest the same is implemented for the commit message box in the git sidebar. This should be no cheap `git log` substitute - you should only see the (last X?) commit messages you have entered yourself on that machine, in the order in which you have entered them. Just a local history of what was entered in that box.

This is somewhat similar to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6190, but different - it has no relation to undoing a commit, it should be there in the commit message box even if there is nothing to commit.

Thanks

data.title: Property names starting with two underscores not handled correctly

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- OS Version: Win 10

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1658949/26257631/ba005f40-3cc1-11e7-851b-671238c2905c.png)

Here's the code:
```js
"use strict";

class Profiler {
	constructor() {
		/**
		 * @type {Set<DataSource>}
		 * @private
		 */
		this.__dataSources = new Set();
	}
}

module.exports = Profiler;
```

data.title: Implement contributable tree views
data.body:
Implement contributed views those can be shown in Explorer as trees. 

- Contribution point to describe a view
- API to register a tree data provider for the view
- Multi views explorer

Actions can be contributed to the following locations by giving proper `when` clause
- View titlebar:  `view/title`
-  On item:`view/item/context`

Example:
```
"contributes": {
    "menus": {
         "view/title": [
	    {
		"command": "extension.commandId",
		"when": "view == viewId",
		"group": "navigation"
	    }
         ],
         "view/item/context": [
	     {
		"command": "extension.commandId",
		"when": "view == viewId && viewItem == contextValue",
	      }
          ]
   }
}
```

### More

- [x] Remember the view collapsible state and size

### Deferred
- [ ] View visibility
- [ ] Extract icons from the resource Uri
- [ ] Tree state persistence
- [ ] Customizable location of the view inside explorer
- [ ] Get children in pages
- [ ] Ability to update the view label

data.title: Box-drawing characters in terminal when using mstest
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In 2 different folders use `dotnet new console` and `dotnet new mstest`
2. Use `dotnet restore` in both projects. Add reference to console project in test project (e.g. via
`dotnet add reference ../consoleprojectfolder/consoleprojectname.csproj`).
3. Make some simple method in console project. My one is
`public static int ReturnNumber(int number) { return number;  }`
4. Make simple unit test method in test project. My one is
`[TestMethod] public void TestMethod1() { Assert.IsTrue(Program.ReturnNumber(1) == 1); }`
5. Run `dotnet test` in test project.
6. Get box-drawing characters in output window.

Is it VS Code issue or system issue?

UPD. CMD sucks. For russian users: set "terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows" to ["-NoExit", "/c", "chcp.com 65001"] in preferences.
![a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16746066/26252993/7d9515f2-3cba-11e7-928d-12c9c3aea7c7.JPG)

data.title: cannot remove config value which isn't added in settings.json
data.body:
Steps to produce:

1. `"editor.wordWrap"` is not defined in settings.json
2. Get config value , which returns OFF as its default value by `config.get<null>(key, null)`
3. Extension doesnt know its defined in  `settings.json` or not - It thinks its defined in `settings.json`.
4. Try to remove the value as `config.update(key, undefined, true)` and get exception something like:

> unable to get offset of undefined.

There should be a way to check the key is defined in `settings.json` or not.

|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.9|
|tabsanity|jedmao|0.0.9|
|contextualduplicate|lafe|0.2.0|
|cppcheck|matthewferreira|0.0.9|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|indent-rainbow|oderwat|0.6.1|
|reloaded-cpp|reloadedextensions|0.1.5|
|reloaded-themes|reloadedextensions|0.2.1|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|vscode-fileutils|sleistner|2.5.1|
|ninja|surajbarkale|0.0.1|
|clang-format|xaver|1.4.0|;


---

Here's a gif of something that happens very frequently. I'm working in C++ but that in and of itself doesn't seem to be the problem:

![autocompletebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1578924/26251317/275e55ac-3cad-11e7-8835-31dd66ae0d9d.gif)

There's actually a few bugs here but this particular issue is about the fact that I need to close the auto-complete window (with escape) and then re-open it (with ctrl-space) for it to provide suggestions that make sense.

I would expect "num_get" to be removed from the list when the current word is "num_b".

data.title: JSDoc typings for React components don't work with .jsx extension
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure file associations are set up like this

```
"files.associations": {
    "*.js": "javascript",
    "*.jsx": "javascriptreact"
},
```

2.  Create a react component with jsdoc typings

```
/**
 * @augments {Component<{searchVm: SearchVm}, {}>}
 */
@inject('searchVm', 'searchMap', 'sidebarFilterStore')
@observer
export default class BillingActivity extends Component {
    render() {
        this.props.
```

the typing don't seem to work - no intellisense shows up.  Changing to a .js file, and of course associating .js with javascriptreact in Code's settings fixes things perfectly, so it does seem to be a matter of the extension.

data.title: 1.12.2 compiled on Windows 7 does not show sidebar, window empty
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 (checked out from tag "1.12.2")
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

- Visual Studio 2015 update 3
- Node.js: 7.9.0 (compiled from source)
- Python 2.7.1 (32-bit)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Execute following commands:

```
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat" x86

set PYTHON=C:\Program Files (x86)\Python271\python.exe

set PATH=%PATH%;C:\Program Files\7-Zip


npm.cmd config set loglevel silly

mkdir tmp

npm.cmd config set cache tmp --global

npm.cmd cache clean

scripts\npm install
```

The above execution seems to work fine, ending with:

```
npm WARN optional SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: fsevents@0.3.8 (node_modules\fsevents):
npm WARN notsup SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: Unsupported platform for fsevents@0.3.8: wanted {"os":"darwin","arch":"any"} (current: {"os":"win32","arch":"ia32"})
npm verb notsup SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: Valid OS:    darwin
npm verb notsup SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: Valid Arch:  any
npm verb notsup SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: Actual OS:   win32
npm verb notsup SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: Actual Arch: ia32
npm verb exit [ 0, true ]
npm info ok
```

2. Try regenerating `monaco.d.ts`:

```
node_modules\.bin\gulp watch
```

3. Compile app:

```
node_modules\.bin\gulp vscode-win32
```


Result:

VSCode shows empty window, no sidebar (the one that pops up after a second or two after stargin the app), menu is visible, but selecting any option in it does not seem to have any effect.

I start vscode by runnning `bin\code-oss.cmd` script. 

The above method worked just fine for me with previous `1.11.2` version.


**UPDATE**

Running dev version produces this error:

```
C:\Acme\Dev\projects\vscode1.12>scripts\code.bat
[15:43:36] Using gulpfile C:\Acme\Dev\projects\vscode1.12\gulpfile.js
[15:43:36] Starting 'clean-electron'...
[15:43:36] Finished 'clean-electron' after 2.91 ms
[15:43:36] Starting 'electron'...
[15:43:40] Finished 'electron' after 3.83 s
[15:43:45] Using gulpfile C:\Acme\Dev\projects\vscode1.12\gulpfile.js
[15:43:45] Starting 'clean-electron'...
[15:43:45] Finished 'clean-electron' after 68 ms
[15:43:45] Starting 'electron'...
[15:43:49] Finished 'electron' after 3.84 s

[8108:0519/154353.910:INFO:CONSOLE(201)] "Loading "gc-signals" failed", source: file:///C:/Acme/Dev/projects/vscode1.12/out/vs/loader.js (201)
[8108:0519/154353.912:INFO:CONSOLE(202)] "Detail: ", source: file:///C:/Acme/Dev/projects/vscode1.12/out/vs/loader.js (202)
[8108:0519/154353.912:INFO:CONSOLE(204)] "Error: The module '\\?\C:\Acme\Dev\projects\vscode1.12\node_modules\gc-signals\build\Release\gcsignals.node'
was compiled against a different Node.js version using
NODE_MODULE_VERSION 50. This version of Node.js requires
NODE_MODULE_VERSION 53. Please try re-compiling or re-installing
the module (for instance, using `npm rebuild` or`npm install`).

    at Object.Module._extensions..node (module.js:598:18)

    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
```
